definition: cannot blame/no wonder
to blame/to complain
(negative prefix)/not/no
structural particle: used after a verb (or adjective as main verb), linking it to following phrase indicating effect, degree, possibility etc
to have to/must/ought to/to need to
to obtain/to get/to gain/to catch (a disease)/proper/suitable/proud/contented/to allow/to permit/ready/finished

sentences.english: No one can blame you although the plan did not work well.
sentences.chinese: 這計劃行不通，怨不得你。

definition: to have only oneself to blame (idiom)/to bring trouble through one's own actions
strange/curious/surprising
to suffer as a consequence of one's own actions/you asked for it/to bring it on oneself (sth unpleasant)
to reap what one has sown (idiom)/to stew in one's own juice
(coll.) serve sb right/deservedly/ought/should
disaster one brings on oneself/to be reponsible for something bad that happens to oneself/to have only oneself to blame
ought to/should
unable to tell good from bad (idiom)/undiscriminating
to ask for trouble (idiom)/to make a rod for one's own back
unable to differentiate good from bad (idiom)/not to know what's good for one/unable to recognize others' good intentions
to follow the path to one's own doom (idiom)/to bring about one's own destruction
to sin
appropriate retribution (idiom)
to blame sb wrongly
to eat one's own fruit (idiom); fig. suffering the consequences of one's own action/to reap what one has sown
guilty and deserves to be punished (idiom); entirely appropriate chastisement/the punishment fits the crime
